summary: In this enthusiastic reaction to the first episode of Arcane, viewers express their surprise and excitement about the show's intense, action-packed opening, which features young characters navigating dangerous situations in a gritty undercity. They are impressed by the animation, raw style, and strong music that perfectly complements the tone of the show. Characters like Powder (who may evolve into Jinx) and Vander are introduced with complex personalities, and the world-building between the upper and lower city adds depth to the narrative. The music and sound design, with their atmospheric and layered qualities, significantly enhance the viewing experience. The episode ends with high stakes, leaving the viewers eager to see more, appreciating the show's blend of intense action, character development, and storytelling.

article: She-Hulk Peter Pan and Wendy the rings of power Captain Marvel The Last Jedi Mulan all products featuring a female lead of significant strength or power all brutally panned by audiences why is that sexism right or maybe it's just bad character writing that's not to Discount the awfulness of any actual hatred of female characters due to their gender but it's quite apparent once you think about it that such hateful commentary only finds any significant audience if the wider less spiteful viewing public dislikes the character for their own more sensible reasons the main reason of course is that so many lead women in film and TV in the past decade are just horribly written there are plenty of exceptions of course and we'll talk about a few of those this is a problem most notable in Disney projects as you could tell from my list but since Disney owns half the world at this point it feels like a wider issue so what exactly makes these characters such bad examples of what a protagonist should be well it's hard to point to any one thing in particular particular not all the characters discussed here will share the same writing flaws they all fail in varying ways but they do have some similarities a common one is being overpowered and not really earning that power the original animated film shows mulan's struggle due to her inexperience and lack of physical prowess but she makes up for those disadvantages by using her wits thinking creatively and refusing to quit even when things seem hopeless the new Mulan is basically a superhero already due to her midichlorians and thus is automatically more skilled than everyone else there's no need for her to use her brain or develop new ways to approach problems leaving the character flat and uninteresting it's worth noting that when I say earning power that doesn't necessarily mean doing something Noble or virtuous that results in the character being given great power as is the case with someone like Captain America most superheroes do not earn their abilities in such a way their powers are forced upon them through chance or freak accident and that's fine however to then earn the power given them the hero should have to struggle in some way to grow into his or her abilities the Tobey Maguire Spider-Man movie is a classic example of this Peter Parker is given superpowers through a random spider bite but he doesn't instantly know what to do with his Newfound abilities nor even how to put them to proper use there are significant Growing Pains as he learns to be the hero he now must become a more recent example of this Trope that was done fairly well is Kate Bishop from the Hawkeye show that at least 20 people watched despite being an incredibly talented Archer and martial artist from the get-go Kate is woefully inexperienced in the world of crime fighting and has to learn how to apply her skills in each new situation relying on the mentorship of Hawkeye himself on the flip side we have characters like She-Hulk and Rey Sky patine Rey's progression through her Jedi training was basically just whatever the plot required at any given moment Jen Walters woke up as She-Hulk and immediately was in full control of her Alter Ego the central struggles that defined the characters from whom these heroin ones were derived are just Stripped Away and not replaced by anything meaningful Jen's defining character moment takes place during a group therapy session when she comes to the realization that she needs to accept that she doesn't need to be She-Hulk to find acceptance that's right the Apex of Jen's character Arc is her deciding that she can be herself this wasn't an issue by the way until after the She-Hulk Persona was present prior to her accident Jen appeared to be quite satisfied with her life for some unknown reason she only decided to get into the dating scene after spending some time as a giant green monster and then found out apparently there is no market for a reasonably attractive 30-something year old lawyer in Los Angeles I don't know about you but to me that feels a bit contrived look I'm not in the online dating scene but I have it on good authority that women tend to get significantly more attention than men do on those apps especially if they happen to be successful and not ugly does this show seriously expect me to believe that the only guy is willing to even talk to Jen Walters are total creeps and losers or alternatively men who are only charming and friendly because they have an agenda speaking of which let's talk about Disney's obsession with promoting and elevating women it's one thing to have female characters who are smart strong persistent and courageous it's quite another to Simply promote the power of women by setting them up on a pedestal that kind of treatment is nothing more than pandering and stories that contain it suffer greatly take for example the recent Peter Pan and Wendy which decided that the all-male cast of Lost Boys wasn't inclusive enough and so tossed some girls into the mix girls can be rough and tumble too you hear uh do you know why the lost boys were originally all boys it's because they fell out of their prams or strollers for you Americans and were carted off to Neverland and girls are far too clever to do such a stupid thing but apparently no one involved in the casting decision had ever read the original novel so here we are or we could talk about Captain Marvel and the thinly veiled metaphor for the patriarchy embodied in the one dude who keeps telling her to not use her true power because that's cheating or whatever and of course She-Hulk seems to be mostly made just to complain about the pig-headedness of men so I'll check over there I'm gonna go talk to it yeah nobody talks like that it should come as no surprise that these shows and movies don't just fail at writing good female characters they're terribly written across the board I'm the Spy what it's not just Rey that the audience dislikes no characters from the Disney Trilogy won the hearts of the audience remember how great of a character Nick Fury was in Captain Marvel yeah neither does anyone else elrond really stood out in the rings of power right okay he actually wasn't terrible he wasn't good but he could have been worse honestly Galadriel could have been worse too not that I think she was well written she wasn't and her introduction in the first episode is basically a how-to course on Annoying audiences we first meet her as she's being tormented by other elf children for having the audacity to think that her origami swan will float not only does this display a severe lack of understanding of what elves are in tolkien's legendarium on the writer's part it demonstrates a cheap trick that modern media likes to use in order to attempt to make the audience like a character forced sympathy the Mantra goes something like this look this character is being mistreated you must then feel bad for her and like her the correct response to that is of course why is this character being mistreated for all we know Galadriel was being a complete twerp just moments before this scene and is totally deserving of having her boat sunk there's no narrative reason that the show gives for collateral to be tormented here it's just an attempt at manipulating the audience into feeling bad for the poor helpless victim and thus hopefully liking her contrast that with Arcane in the plight of Vin and powder the show opens with an actually tragic scene and it doesn't stoop to the pointed Petty tactics of rings of power Galadriel lives in valinor a place of transcendent peace and Harmony so the writers contrived in inane attempt at sympathy Arcane is set largely in a brutal slum of a city but it gives its main character a Plucky Relentless attitude that rejects the victimhood status which so many other are modern properties confer upon their heroines because if you're a victim how can anyone hate you well it's pretty easy when you're incredibly smug and don't give a rat's ass about the safety of your troops the me against the world vibes from Galadriel in the first episode are just so tired and overdone we know she's going to be right about Sauron still being around because of course she is she can take down the ice troll single-handedly because of course she can however that on its own would not necessarily be bad writing Galadriel because that is what the show calls her is quite old and thus an experienced Warrior I am willing to accept that this character has spent centuries in combat and thus is highly skilled and capable of such Feats what makes this scene so absurd is that all the other elves around her these Warriors hand-picked to exterminate Sauron and the remnants of his armies are completely and totally hapless and helpless to the point that they might as well be a different species than their leader it's totally fine to have protagonists who are supremely skilled but it's a really poor choice to have the supporting characters be complete buffoons in order to Showcase that skill Galadriel might as well just be out there on her own really most of the examples I've listed tend to just do things solo it is up to them and them alone to win the day as in Captain Marvel and Mulan all they really need to do is seize the power that is already within them to throw off the shackles others would impose upon them and victory is theirs the dramatic shift between victimhood and total power is what these movies believe to be meaningful character work but it's really just a violent swing from one extreme to the other and neither end of the spectrum is healthy there's a huge difference between having agency and being World conquering forces of nature that only needed to shrug off the hands holding them down if you're going to write the hero of a story a central character who ultimately is able to conquer the evil he or she faces you need to make them earn it that protagonist needs to struggle or even suffer as they obtain the strength necessary to win the day ideally they would find such strength through meaningful relationships or by learning from those wiser or more experienced than them recent examples of this done at least fairly well Rita vertaski a supremely skilled Soldier having to work together with Tom Cruise's character whose name I forget to gradually establish a plan to win the war by being motivated by love for her sister relying on others in her fight badly missing the guidance of her father figure Kate Bishop being mentored by Hawkeye as she realizes how ill-prepared she is for the world she has stumbled into there are plenty of other examples of female protagonists who match that description but I wanted to point out some from within the last decade to emphasize the point that audiences do not by and large just hate any strong woman on screen right now just the ones whose character arcs are flatter than the state of Kansas characters who need only achieve self-actualization are not only boring and lack meaningful character work they teach us awful lessons the idea that all that is needed for success is to seize the strength and power already within you is a harm powerful notion that discredits the value of relationships personal growth and humility you are sufficient these stories tell their audiences you don't need to change our heroes are supposed to inspire us either by their ability to grow beyond their own flaws and failures or despite being Paragons of virtue and goodness still having to struggle against overwhelming odds and having to use their wits to be creative to trust their team to win the day indeed some of the most admirable characters in fiction ones who do not suffer all that much personal growth due to having already attained great virtue find themselves insufficient this is most clear in tolkien's work where characters such as faramir Theoden and Aragorn Great Men Who suffer little if any inner turmoil at least in the books are not able to win the day but rather can only play their part in the war that will Define the future of Middle Earth they teach us the message we need to hear the message that Disney and Hollywood want to keep from our ears that is is you are not enough but you still can do great things they may not bring you glory they may even bring you pain and suffering but if you put the good of others before your own needs and wants you will find true and Lasting happiness so many modern heroines fail to win the love of the audience because they take shortcuts to power they are elevated by the story rather than having to climb up their own character Arc they are shallow character molds created largely to prove a point or push an agenda and perhaps most importantly they tend to care for themselves their own success their own ideas of what it means to be fulfilled Hollywood and Disney in particular seem to want so badly to provide us with examples of powerful women but they fail to understand what makes for a good example or role model the heroines they prop up are too often shallow unlikable and exhibit many of the traits such as arrogance and abrasiveness that their creators find abhorrent and male protagonists how is this fixed simple create characters to tell a story not to prove a point either show flawed characters who have to grow and change to heal their inner wounds and overcome their shortcomings or give us Paragons of virtue who have to struggle sacrifice and suffer due to the evil they face but most importantly write characters whose defining moments do not come as they realize their own worth and value that they themselves are sufficient but rather as they decide to take selfless action for the good of others I can't carry it for you but I can't carry you well those are all my rambling thoughts on the matter I hope we see lots more characters like by Kim Wexler Rita vertaski and Evelyn from The Quiet Place movies I just realized two of those characters are played by Emily Blunt no surprise they are
summary: The video critiques modern female protagonists, particularly in Disney projects, arguing they are often overpowered and lack meaningful character development. Characters like She-Hulk, Rey, and Mulan are criticized for not earning their power, making their arcs feel shallow. The video contrasts these with well-written female characters like Kate Bishop, Rita Vrtaski, and Evelyn, who face struggles, rely on others, and grow throughout their stories. The main issue is that modern media often elevates characters for the sake of an agenda, rather than through organic, earned development. The video advocates for creating characters with flaws and growth rather than simply promoting them as 'strong.'

article: this is jinx pretty evil right well what if I told you she's actually not the bad person everyone sees her as now before you call me insane let's rewind for a moment before the chaos before the name Jinx there was just powder a scared wide-eyed girl trying to navigate the harsh realities of the world around her picture this she's growing up in zhan a city where survival isn't guaranteed and danger is always lurking just around the corner and then tragedy strikes her parents gone killed during the brutal piltover zon conflict in an instant her entire sense of safety is ripped away wasn't the calculated Act of a villain this was the tragic gut-wrenching mistake of a child who only wanted to help imagine being powder in that moment the crushing realization that your best effort to save the people you love has backfired in possibly the worst way that kind of guilt that kind of self-blame is not something you just carry it literally shapes you it Corps how you see the world and how you see yourself now this moment this devastating explosion became the foundation for everything that followed but that's just the start to really understand her story we need to dig even deeper what happens when you lose everything and then find yourself completely alone after that fateful explosion Jinx was left completely alone the world she knew had crumbled and the one person she trusted Above All Else VI was gone no goodbye no explanation just gone imagine that for a moment that one constant in your life disappears without a trace for jinx this wasn't just abandonment it was like the last piece of her fragile Foundation had been ripped away left to fend for herself in a brutal and unforgiving World Jinx spiraled self-doubt began to consume her was I the problem did I drive her away and that doubt quickly turned into anger and confusion she was desperate for answers but all she got was silence but that wasn't the worst of it her mind began to turn on her the explosion the Betrayal the loneliness it all created this storm of guilt and grief one that really never left her she began hearing the voices of her past her memories twisting into haunting hallucinations it's like her trauma created an endless loop replaying her worst mistakes over and over again and these hallucinations they're not just background noise they taunt her mock her they remind her of every failure every moment she thinks she's let someone down how could anyone think clearly under that kind of weight so when Jinx lashes out when her actions seem Reckless or even cruel it's not because she wants to hurt anyone it's because she's desperately trying to Shield herself she's building walls pushing people away doing whatever it takes to protect what little is left of her heart it's heartbreaking really her world is chaos because she's fighting the chaos inside of her and when you look at it that way it's hard not to see her as the victim of her circumstances rather than a villain but there's more to her story because while her struggles are undeniably tragic they also lead us to the question are her actions really as evil as they seem now let's talk about jinx's actions on the surface it's easy to label them as pure chaos right explosions destruction unpredictable Behavior it all screams villain but if you dig deeper you'll see there's something more to her story take a step back and ask yourself why does she do what she does her motives aren't rooted in evil they're rooted in fear and Desperation think about this everything she's ever car about has either been ripped away from her or Twisted beyond recognition she's terrified of losing what little she has left so when Jinx creates destruction it's not random it's her way of holding on to memories to relationships to her own fractured sense of reality one of the most powerful examples of this is in the dinner scene picture it Jinx sets the table bringing together VI Silko and even Caitlyn not to assert dominance but to find Clarity she's not playing the villain here she's desperately trying to figure out who she can trust but her emotions are so overwhelming so tangled that chaos becomes the only language she knows how to speak her behavior in that moment it's heartbreaking the people she loves are at odds and she's caught in the middle drowning in betrayal and insecurity her actions seem erratic sure but they're not coming from a place of malice they're coming from a place of pain and isn't that what makes her so compelling Jinx isn't trying to destroy the world she's trying to survive in it to piece together a life that makes sense when nothing around her does her explosions her attacks they're not about harming others they're about protecting herself from being hurt again so is she a villain or is she someone just trying to navigate a broken world the only way she knows how as we look closer that line becomes blurrier and blurrier it's so tempting isn't it to point to jinx and say that's the villain after all she leaves a trail of Destruction wherever she goes buildings crumble lives are lost and Chaos seems to follow her like a shadow but stop for a second and ask yourself are her actions really so different from everyone else fighting to survive in a world like Zan think about it the piltover enforcers the km Barons and even Vai they all make choices that lead to violence and destruction but because they have a badge a mission or a justifiable cause we're quick to rationalize their actions Jinx though she's labeled as Reckless dangerous evil but what if we flip that perspective what if her so-called chaos is simply her way of coping with a broken system A system that failed her at every turn her explosions they're not random their cries for control in a life that's been anything but stable her attacks their desperate attempts to protect herself from being hurt again sure her methods are extreme but they're not born out of malice they're rooted in fear pain and a desire to matter in a world that constantly dismisses her and here's the kicker if you really take a step back and see the world through her eyes the line between hero and villain doesn't just blur it practically disappears what's left is a young woman fighting to survive in the only way she knows how and that's not evil that's human now that we've seen how jinx's chaos isn't as black and white as it seemed let's dive deeper into the emotional core of her story because the real tragedy isn't the destruction she causes it's in what she lost along the way jinx's story isn't one of Pure Evil it's the story of a child shaped by a series of events so devastating so relentless that they broke her in ways the world refused to mend it's about trauma that fested in isolation a soul who didn't choose destruction but was led there by a series of betrayals and heart breaks from the loss of her parents to the shattering guilt of her accident Jinx has been fighting battles no one truly sees but here's the thing when you look closely her chaos isn't random it's not senseless it's a desperate cry for understanding for connection for someone to prove to her that she's not alone think of every time she lashes out like I've said it's not because she enjoys it it's because it's all she knows how to do when the world feels like it's slipping away from her again and maybe that's the most tragic part of all her story didn't have to go this way if someone anyone had stepped in to truly understand her to give her the space and support to heal who knows what she would have become maybe instead of jinx we'd be talking about powder the brilliant Fearless girl who only wanted to belong maybe the real tragedy of jinx isn't the destruction she causes it's that no one ever gave her the chance to heal and that I think is something worth thinking about who else in this world in our world is being left behind in the same way so what's your take do you see jinx as a misunderstood Soul shaped by her pain or something else entirely let's start a conversation drop your thoughts in the comments below I'd love to hear your perspective on her journey and hey if you enjoyed unpacking jinx's story make sure to like this video it really helps the channel grow also don't forget to subscribe and hit that Bell so you won't miss out on our next Deep dive into complex fascinating characters just like Jinx thank you for watching and until next time stay curious
summary: The video reexamines Jinx from Arcane, arguing that she's not purely evil but a misunderstood character shaped by trauma. Initially, she was Powder, a girl trying to navigate a harsh world, whose tragic mistake during an attempt to save her family left her guilt-ridden and alone. As Jinx, she spirals into chaos, but her actions are driven by fear and desperation, not malice. Her explosions and reckless behavior are cries for control and connection, reflecting her struggle to cope with a broken system and past betrayals. The video challenges the notion of her as a villain, suggesting that her true tragedy lies in her lack of support and the missed opportunity for healing.

summary: The relationship between Ekko and Jinx, known as 'Time Bomb,' is marked by deep emotional complexity, blending nostalgia, love, and tragedy. Initially hinted at in the game lore and later explored in Arcane, their bond evolves through heartbreaking moments, particularly Ekko's internal struggle between his memories of Powder (Jinx's former self) and the violent, unpredictable woman she becomes. Despite minimal interaction in the show, fan interest skyrocketed due to their shared past and emotional depth. Ekko's refusal to kill Jinx, even after her many actions that hurt him, exemplifies the lingering attachment to the girl he once knew. In alternate timelines, Ekko experiences a world where things could have been better, showing his yearning for a life with Jinx that never fully materializes. The ships tragic appeal lies in the bittersweetness of their connection, marked by moments of joy amidst an inevitable separation, reflecting the broader theme of lost potential. Their story leaves fans imagining alternate realities and what could have been.

summary: Arcane is not officially considered part of the main League of Legends canon, with Riot acknowledging its distinct universe, though it may influence future lore. The core universe differs significantly from Arcane, especially in character backstories and events. For instance, Jace in the core universe is more arrogant, and his connection to Victor and Hextech development differs from Arcane's portrayal. Vi's origins as an orphan differ from her Arcane story, where she is taken in by Vander after her parents' deaths. Jinx's story in the core universe lacks the depth and backstory provided in Arcane. Caitlyns arc is also more faithful to her canon version, with no significant connections to the other characters. Singeds backstory in the core universe is similarly different, focusing on his work in Piltover and his experiments, while Echos origin and relationship with his parents in the core universe contrasts with the more orphaned version seen in Arcane. The show presents a reimagined version of many characters, deviating from their established lore, leading to fan desire for it to become canon.

article: Arcane is a masterclass in how to write amazing women every one of these characters is just a work of art and storytelling and characterization and it's weird to say but it seems like everyone is happy which is crazy no one ever agrees on stuff like this so what happened how is it all so good so while I as a man definitely hesitate to make a video that's like allow me a male man to tell all you female women how to write the ladies this is about Arcane not about me you know if anything this is about me as a writer who is really looking for guidance on this topic not a lot of stories do this this well and as a guy I really want to learn more about how to write great women characters and this show just taught me so much so this video isn't a how too it's about what I personally learned and these are basically just a bunch of incredible storytelling things that Arcane did that I believe deserve to be highlighted and celebrated and encouraged and I love any and all discussion in the comments adding questioning critiquing whatever the more the merrier especially if you're a woman and you have opinions on this kind of thing I'm here to learn so I want to hear your thoughts and by the way let me add one really surprising thing about this whole situation which is that AR Kean does a lot of things that could go really wrong a lot of tropes that are just like minefields for bad writing when it comes to women Arcane has a manipulative seductive fem fatal they have a macho action girl who beats up Men twice their size they have a manic pixie SL broken girl who's arguably fixed by man they have a beautiful but doesn't realized Outcast girl who gets a naked shower scene and the way arcan does it it's great it works it's all these things that we want in our lady characters deep Nuance realistic empowering so let's get to the actual characters here I want to go through each character in relation to topic or Trope where I think the writing really made them shine and the first of those characters is is Mel and the first topic is agency agency is the ability of characters to make choices that change the course of events and the exercising of that ability and this is a big one I think this is the main thing we see in failed attempts at writing strong women what we often see is characters who might be physically strong might be skilled might be independently minded but then we see them just being tossed around by the plot or by the decisions of the men in the story never making any actual decisions themselves arcanes women have agency they make a ton of important decisions Mel has the final say with the development of hex she pushes for hex weapons she pushes for war and then changes course and pushes for peace and the whole time she is the pivotal voice on the council leading them in whatever decision they make Seva is a henchwoman which seems like a very follower role but remember that she basically makes Silko she dethrones Vander takes away all his power and makes Silko the new Under City boss VI disobeys Vander to sacrifice herself and then when he exercises his agency right back to stop her she uses hers again to go after him and fight for him Jinx def finds her own identity at the end she sets the whole thing up figures it out on her own and then takes action when she's done but I think Mel is the best example of this she starts out with an incredible amount of agency in the form of actual political power she has like a direct onetoone influence over other council members she's wealthy and proactively seeking to increase her wealth and influence but like I mentioned a lot of women start out in positions like these where they hold positions of power and we already to see them use it and then something happens why or really where do characters like this lose their agency so I think it most often gets lost when the characters get into relationships especially if it's an important charismatic man with strong opinions or a strong role it also can often get lost and developing conflicts and the weaknesses of the character and the other scenario is that it often gets taken away by a competing strong woman Mel meets each of these scenarios coming out stronger than she was when she went in she gets into a relationship with Jace and by the way even getting into this relationship she has a rare show of agency she sleeps with Jace because she wants him that's not something you usually see Star is letting women do it's taboo but Arcane showcases that decision of hers very openly and confidently but anyway she gets into this relationship and he doesn't take away her agency at all on the contrary she uses the relationship to further her goal and then she confronts her weakness who is a strong woman literally coming to take away her agency and she doesn't let her she grows through that experience and ends up in a situation where she and jce are equally dependent on each other's agency to bring the council to vote for peace Jace initiates it but the council violently protests until Mel changes their course by exerting her political influence which far supered chases so Mel starts with agency and it only increases but I want to zero in here on one characteristic of mels that relates very strongly to her agency really one of her most Central characteristics overall and it feels a little weird highlighting this as a central characteristic because normally that's bad writing and or just not true that it matters so much but here it does matter and it's great writing so one of Mel's most prominent features is how beautiful she is and making this a major characteristic of a woman is often a recipe not just for shallowness but for passivity that's why we think of it as a bad thing to build a character around but for Mel her beauty does the opposite it's an aid to her agency she uses her beauty to get done what she wants to get done and it's not just a one note bat my eyelashes get money type trade no she already manipulates people in all kinds of ways complex Ways by appealing to faulty self-image by offering them Power by scaring them by bribing them this is a character who can paint a picture and use it to unsettle two different characters in two completely different ways she uses everything at her disposal to send messages Foster relationships manipulate people whatever she needs to do to achieve her ends so they took this characteristic which has such potential to erase complexity and take away agency and they use it to add to her complexity and Aid her agency and just to talk a bit more how this relates to some of the other characters just like with Mel it's very clear that Arina is using a character first approach when it comes to attractiveness which is why they end up with hot characters that are also good characters and to contrast when we see a poorly written hot character it's like the starting point is the characteristic they pick a characteristic that's attractive like a boob and now what sort of person shall we craft around this boob and that's obviously Destin for shallow when you start from the other way from the character it leads to a much more layered approach to character attractiveness VI is a fighter what type of attractiveness are we going to give her well a character with her skill set wouldn't be voluptuous she'd be toned she'd have confidence Swagger she'd have scars we take elements of her story she's a prisoner so she has tattoos she has a jacket she stole from someone who's trying to mug her Jinx you know Jinx was an interesting challenge because she was designed in game to be the Psycho Sexy type by the way not letting the fan base know if she's of legal age very efficient meta summary: Arcane excels at writing strong, nuanced female characters, defying common tropes and showcasing their agency. Characters like Mel, VI, and Jinx exemplify how women can hold power, make pivotal decisions, and maintain their complexity without losing their autonomy, even when faced with challenges such as romantic relationships or strong adversaries. The show subverts traditional tropes, using attributes like beauty and strength to enhance character depth rather than reduce it, portraying women as multifaceted individuals with their own desires and motivations. VI's portrayal avoids typical action girl pitfalls, showing her strength through vulnerability and resilience. By creating diverse female characters with agency, Arcane offers a masterclass in character writing.

I recruited Arcane on my own for $0 the series holds the record of being the most expensive animated series ever created now I wanted to see if I can recreate a scene from the show without spending any money at all all the tools I use will be free and all the assets I need will be made by me and after looking at every official making of material I could find I think I've not only discovered the techniques they've used to create the show but also what it takes to create something truly special yeah you make me nous true this was probably the most important part of this whole project if I can't recreate this rocket launcher close enough I might as well cancel the whole project because it will only really get harder from here and I need it for the actual scene anyway so I might as well start with it as a 3D artist creating the model wasn't really an issue I was more worried about the special technique Arcane uses to shade their 3D objects they paint every model including some of the shadows and highlights by hand the last time I painted a model in this way it was almost 2 years ago so I wasn't really sure if I could recreate the style well enough now I started by blocking out the basic colors and some simple Shadows to define the basic shapes of the model afterwards I refined the most important parts which also allowed me to add smaller details that aren't actually in the 3D model itself now it already looks pretty good but it doesn't really react to any Lighting in the 3D scene yet so to finish it I plugged the final textures into a Shader so that it looks like it is actually living in the environment around it and this is the final result I think this looks good enough to continue so now let's go a little bit more in depth and see what it takes to create a full Arcane style animation St for a minute just like creating the rocket launcher you can separate the process for the whole animation into two main steps as well with one bonus Step at the end that the creators like to call the secret ingredient this three-step process is what most objects go through to reach their final look in the show including of course Jinx no off I'm I'm try Focus figh I started by sculpting her body with the help of some references from the show in most big Productions you would start with 2D concept art for each character and then 3D artists try to cre those Concepts as closely as [Music] possible the scene I'm trying to recreate is the one at the end of season 1 where she fires the rocket launcher for the first time I already have one part of it so all that's missing now is jinx there's also the environment but I don't need to create a 3D model for that and I will explain why a bit later during the process for now the main and most important goal is to recreate jinx as closely as possible the biggest problem with that is just like her rocket launcher a lot of the details on her have been added while painting her textures they're not part of the actual 3D model which makes working with references a lot harder luckily I actually found a render of her without the textures as well look at how different she looks so much smoother than you might expect this is intentional to make the textures look as good as possible once you add lighting to them as well but that cre another problem for me I can try to create the 3D model as closely as possible but until I have painted her textures I don't really know if I've captured her look well enough if everything goes wrong I might have to redo the whole 3D model these moments of uncertainty happened multiple times during this project either because I had to work up to a certain step to see if the results look good enough or even worse I tried a technique I've never really used before and with jinx's body and outfit looking pretty good so far one of those scary steps was coming up next the hair in Arcane has a very unique look it's made up of these very big and Broad shapes combined with smaller sometimes very fine strands which confused me a little bit at first I watched every making off video I could find to figure out how they created it until I found this 1 second clip that told me that they've used xgen it's a common tool mainly used to create 3D hairstyles with individual strands just like real hair and unfortunately it's part of Maya which costs all the money so I had to stick to using blender myself but now I had to make a decision I can either create a reliable and pretty good looking hairstyle with blender's hair prodicle system or create a great looking hairstyle by basically programming my own unique hair system using geometry nodes that is much riskier unstable and might not even work at all and could easily waste more than 20 hours in the process I decided to do option two and guess what it only took uh 44 hours and I'm sure nothing will go wrong with it in the future anyway let me show you how it works to summarize the very boring math behind this first you create a tube like this then the system turns it into these hair strands and afterwards you can customize it with the settings the last thing missing is the Shader which I learned how to create through this tutorial by lightning Boy Studio now with her 3D model finished there are two more steps to finish the 3D portion of this project for her to move she needs to have a rig basically a skeleton to move the different parts of her body this process can get very complex depending on how much control you want to have while animating luckily blender has an amazing free add-on called rigify that allows you to create one of these complex rigs with a single button press all you need to do is place the basic bones and the add-on will do the rest automatically and after a little bit of tweaking and adjusting it works pretty well you can actually do quite a lot with this rig now but one thing you can't do is this right here forti the studio behind arcade not only used rigs to control their characters but also shape Keys shape keys are optional deformations on the model that you can use to create certain effects they're often used for example to make Expressions more expressive or here for example they created them to make Jinx look younger and more innocent I created that same slider from my model 2 as well as two more to have a bit more control over her lips but you could go a lot further with these if you really wanted to and now the last 3D part of this project is the actual animation of course she can't just look like Jinx she also needs to move like her so to recreate the scene as closely as possible I placed the original animation with transparency over my 3D camera my first goal was to match the most significant poses as best as I can afterwards I can blend between them with a few more in between poses and blenders automatic interpolation which fills the rest of the frames this is actually how most animations are created first you lay out the most important poses then you create the rest to blend between them the difference between me and the actual animators on Arcane is of course that they didn't have this perfect reference to trace instead they filmed themselves acting out the scenes to better understand how the character needs to move during them so they don't have to guess the whole animation process went surprisingly smooth there were not really any problems that occurred during this step except for my custom hair system of course and if I can't fix this issue I might have to create the entire hairstyle again from scant with the other system but you know what this can wait let's do something more exciting [Music] first texture painting is one of the things I was the least comfortable with during this whole project but after painting the rocket launcher I felt at least a bit more confident in my skills I basically just followed the same process again first blocking out the general shapes and colors then refining everything and adding some more [Music] detail on its own blender's texture painting has always been extremely annoying and tedious to me but there were two things I used during this project that made the process a lot more enjoyable the first is a free add-on called yuku paint it adds essential features like paint layers as well as some really great quality of life features like automatic Shadow Generation or a much easier way to work out basic colors if you do a lot of texture painting this add-on is really really good especially in combination with the second thing which is my own custom brush pack blender itself only really has a single round default brush which is exactly why I created this brush pack with 50 custom brushes to cover as many use cases as possible for this Arcane project it actually worked pretty well to only use the hard round brush to paint everything but in my previous project for example I use it to paint This Grass Hill covered in snow for my berserk animation or to recreate this scene from Spirited Away if you're interested in getting this pack for yourself make sure to check out the first link in the description and now with my custom brushes in hand my plan for the texture painting was once again to only really refine the parts that are clearly visible and leave the rest in a fairly rough State just to save a little bit of time that I could then use to fix my hair system [Music] now it was finally time to see whether my Jinx looks like the original or I have to redo a bunch of stuff the biggest thing I struggled with was imitating this looseness that the original has sometimes the colors blend really well together and sometimes you can clearly see some very broad brush Strokes that look kind of rough but still somehow with the result now let's see if I can figure this miss out and I actually did it only took 6 hours this time basically nothing now it's basically perfect except for this flickering that I just could not nope you know what I want that to be there anyway speaking of texture painting I also painted the environment well at least partially I basically grabbed a shot from the original and used photo a free web version version of Photoshop to remove Jinx from the shot and if that didn't work completely I fixed the rest in blender using texture painting now there are only two more steps left before the animation is fully done one of them is fairly simple the other one is the step I was the most excited but also the most scared [Music] of the first one are the 2D VFX in the actual show 2D animators created these extra Effects by painting on top of the 3D animation probably in a software made for 2D animation that costs a lot of money but you can create something pretty similar in blender as well by adding a grease pencil object into the 3D scene you can paint basically anywhere in 3D space so to paint the VX on top I just place the drawing layer in front of my 3D camera so it covers the scene behind it now all I had to do is redraw the animation from the original frame by frame which wasn't really that hard it just took a long time [Music] time for this I also decided not to trace the frames exactly like I did for the 3D animations because I thought drawing them myself would be more fun it's a pretty simple process overall and I'm sure I've missed some steps that made this process a lot better but also a lot harder in the actual show but that's how I created these shots for my own version now on to the last and probably also most important step of them all the secret ingredient that makes Arcane look so great this tiny clip perfectly shows what that means all the elements of the scene are already there in the shot but what gives the show its unique look and feel is being created during the composition stage they are intentionally vague about this process in they're making off videos so it's hard to find any concrete info but here's how I think they did it looking at this clip again the process seems to start with the raw textures without any lighting then during compositing the lighting gets added in some sort of way on top of that we can also see some more typical effects like lens dird or glare that you would usually add during compositing as well as the 2D effects of course that need to be combined with the 3D animation at some point to me it seems like they collect all the elements that make up a scene separately and then combine them all together in compositing to create the final look the reason why I think they do it that way is because that gives them ultimate creative control don't like the shading on the face just remove it from where you don't want it and enhance it where you need more don't like the hair color well now you can change it want to put more emphasis on the eyes select only the eyes to brighten them so they stick out more this ultimate flexibility is I think what allowed them to create such a unique animation style in the first place the 3D render gives you photo realistic shading but you don't have to use it if you think it looks better without it maybe you want to add your own
summary: The transcript describes the creation of an Arcane-inspired animation using free tools and self-made assets. The process involved modeling, texturing, rigging, and animating a scene from the show, focusing on replicating the unique visual style of Arcane, especially its hand-painted 3D textures and distinctive hair. The creator had to overcome challenges such as mastering the show's shading techniques, creating a custom hair system, and dealing with uncertainty about whether the results would match the original's look. It also highlights the importance of compositing, where raw textures, lighting, and 2D effects were combined to achieve the final style. The project was supported by the community through Patreon and merchandise sales, with plans for further episodes.

summary: The main question about Jinxs fate in Arcane is not whether she's alive, but where she is going and why. After the events of Season 2, it's clear Jinx is still alive, despite her low point in jail where she reflects on the cycle of violence she is caught in, largely due to the creation of Hextech and its consequences. Her struggle centers on breaking free from this cycle, which she initially believes can only be ended by her death. As the story progresses, parallels between timelines and her relationships with characters like Vi and Ekko show her internal conflict, with Ekko ultimately preventing her from taking her own life, offering her hope and the possibility of a new beginning. Despite the destruction around her, including the looming Noxus-Piltovian war, Jinx's journey appears to be shifting towards finding a way to move forward, not by ending her life but by letting go of the past and forging a new path.

summary: Netflix's Arcane Season 2, though praised for its animation quality, was rushed due to the cancellation of the show before its release, despite its success. The series, which cost $250 million to produce, was considered a loss for Netflix and Riot, who hoped to use the show to drive interest in the League of Legends game. Riot plans to continue the League of Legends cinematic universe with at least three spinoffs, focusing on different regions and champions. Jinxs story, which appeared to end on a cliffhanger, hints at her survival and return in future projects. The planned spinoffs include shows set in Noxus, Ionia, and Demacia, with more characters and storylines to explore.

summary: The scene described highlights a powerful and unique entrance by Jinx in a battle, where her presence and confidence are central to the turning point of the conflict. The transition from a tense, philosophical atmosphere to a chaotic, unrestrained energy underscores Jinx's character development and newfound strength, influenced by both Vi and Ekko. Her entrance is marked by artistic self-expression and confident body language, symbolizing her evolution. This moment contrasts traditional strength with chaos, using music and visual style to emphasize Jinx's impact, marking her as a game-changing force and a memorable symbol of rebellion and transformation.

summary: Only JS, a controversial TikTok creator, gained fame in 2018 but has faced a steady decline in popularity due to multiple scandals, especially around her racist behavior. Initially rising through viral life hack videos, she was fired from Best Buy, which pushed her into full-time content creation. However, her online career was marred by a 2016 racist message leak, prompting a failed public apology deemed insincere. Her efforts to atone, such as promising collaborations with black creators, fell apart when she failed to follow through, further damaging her reputation. Despite initial support, her actions, including blaming ADHD for her shortcomings and a ghostwritten apology, have left her with a tarnished image and a petition for her removal from TikTok.

summary: Isa's character in *Arcane* parallels Powders journey, both being introduced through failed attempts to make a significant leap, with Isa unintentionally saved by Jinx, contrasting Vis more intentional care for Powder. Over time, Isa transforms from an independent character to a Jinx clone, symbolized by her design and emotional connection to Jinx, signified by elements like her bunny ears and helmet, which represent protection and vulnerability. Isas reckless self-sacrifice mirrors Jinx's own destructive tendencies, and her death serves as a catalyst for Jinx's growth, pushing her toward the adult version seen later. Isas actions reflect her ideological commitment to Jinx, embodying the hope and sacrifice that will shape Jinxs evolution.

It moves on to making gnocchi from leftover potatoes, using flour, ricotta, and thyme, followed by boiling and sauting the gnocchi with fresh peas and butter. Each recipe focuses on using fresh ingredients, minimal preparation, and efficient cooking techniques.

article: my next recipe is an old classic roast chicken but with a simple twist it takes on a new life and it's guaranteed to impress one of the things i love about cooking and that keeps me excited after 25 years behind the stove is that there's always something new to learn every day new ingredients new techniques and new cuisines start off with the stuffing it's amazing how exciting a stuffed roast chicken can be because it keeps the chicken incredibly moist and gives a delicious texture inside the bird i'm going to start off with cured cereso this is a traditional spanish sausage and it's garlicky spicy incredibly meaty that gives a little bit of sort of richness to the stuffing get that chorizo in start cooking that down and getting all those oils out a little touch of olive oil in there to get it going right onions chopped add the onions to the cerezo and in a matter of seconds they'll change color as they soak up all the flavor that lovely spiciness has been stolen from that sausage now the onions smell incredible garlic garlic fresh thyme just hold it down and get your fingers on there and it's a really nice way of taking off all those nice fragrant little time flowers you can hear crackling in the background these are cannellini beans they're waxy very soft and so delicious but very dense but for stuffing they're so robust nothing breaks down drain them off in they're going to take on all that juice as well from the freezer i'm going to season them now because they're very dense so it needs some help that looks like it's a dish on its own good enough to eat now i want to sweeten things up a little bit tomatoes half dried in that sweetens up the stuffing beautiful the stuffing's ready look at the color everything looks spanish it looks delicious now stuffing the chicken i like taking off these little knuckles as the chicken cooks the skin stretches over the bone you can get a really nice drum and take off those little wingtips as well salt pepper so important now you're stuffing i'm gonna go right inside the chicken push it down this really helps to cook the bird evenly because you're pushing out all the empty spaces in the carcass and take a nice large lemon push the lemon in pick up the parsley's nose pull the skin over olive oil on top salt and pepper a teaspoon of paprika sprinkle it on and then get your hands and sort of rub that in and see what the paprika is doing to the chicken putting this like sweet spicy marinade it's not even roasted yet but it looks delicious [Music] 400 ml of white wine same quantity of water that helps the chicken to steam chicken in be generous with the time sprigs [Music] make sure the fall is folded tightly around the roasting tray so the chicken steams in the oven keeping it moist and juicy into the oven cook for one hour at 180 degrees with a foil on nice take it out and remove the full lid then give it another 30 minutes to crisp up that skin [Music] look at that it's so important to make sure you take that tinfoil off with half an hour to go beautiful pierce that open squeeze it in that delicious gravy mix that into the tray and sieve that that's really nice fragrant lemony spiced roasting juices to finish before we cut up the chicken take out amazing stuffing [Music] incredible i'd have that with chicken over potatoes any day and then just get your chicken roasting juices now to cut the chicken up hold the drum and slice straight through and there's a wonderful drum and the thigh through the wishbone off slice with the point at an angle so you can see the texture of that amazing roast chicken just take my cooking juices just want to give a nice sort of lemony flavor over my chicken and there you go a delicious very charming stuffed roast chicken my next recipe is easy and a pleasure to make if you're organized with everything ready in advance [Music] miso poached salmon with asian vegetables organization is key in the kitchen take a couple of minutes before you start and set yourself up make sure you know where everything is stock spatula pan etc it becomes less stressful but more importantly the end results are incredible [Music] first off get your pan on whisk and stock start off with this amazing fermented soy bean puree into the pan three nice tablespoons gas on now get your fish stock and whisk into the puree be generous with the stock you want this nice light broth basically you can buy miso paste from big supermarkets and it works brilliantly with salmon poaching the salmon in the miso stuff gives it a really nice sort of sweet earthy creamy flavor it's incredible bring it to the bowl i'm gonna infuse the broth and make it a little bit more fragrant kaffir lime leaf is very lemony inside the miso broth then chopped chili chilli's in and finely sliced ginger that's simmering beautifully now we're going to poach the salmon poaching means cooking it in liquid but it's cooked gently and the secret here is to keep that salmon skin on if we took the skin off now the salmon can actually break up whilst it's poaching skin side down i'm just going to slide that in under nice the minute that stock starts boiling turn it down let it simmer take a little ladle and just every couple of minutes pour over that make sure the top of the salmon is cooked evenly and keeps it nice and moist and poaching is one of the most delicate ways of cooking so you have to handle it with care whilst the salmon's poaching in the miso broth start preparing your vegetables i'm using tender stem broccoli and bak choy i always like to cook the leaf and the stem separately the leaf is like sort of spinach and the stem is so much thicker it's almost as thick as a stick of celery so i like to get the stems sliced just so i've got that nice sort of christmas place the leaves together nicely roll them up nice and tight and then slice them down now my salad already the flavor in that broth has been elevated it tastes really fishy you've got the heat the chili spiciness the ginger and the caffeine lime leaf take your fish slice and place it very gently underneath the salmon and push it down fish slices are flexible for that reason bend it lift it up just touch looking for a springy firm texture and just sit there on top a little touch of the broth over it it stops it from drying out leave that to cool down for two minutes bring the stock back up to the boil broccoli and bak choy stems in a little taste it's getting better and better and better cook the broccoli and the bok choy stems for one minute and then add the tops in turn the salmon into your hand and just peel all that skin off the skin also helps to keep the salad nice and moist then gently flake the salmon that's the secret behind poaching everything just stays so moist wonderful long shards of pink now just before we serve we're going to add our mushrooms these are enoki mushrooms you can buy these in oaky mushrooms in big supermarkets and good grocers slice them off i'm going to put half in and the other half i'm gonna serve with the salmon toasted sesame seed oil put a little drip in there just rub and you're just lining almost like a little coat of varnish start off with your mushrooms and then my salmon four nice layers and then finally the mushrooms top with the vegetables and then finally a nice ladle that beautiful really sumptuous rich stock lovely and that is an amazing misu poached salmon soup simplify your cooking by getting organized and amazing food will be coming out your kitchen every day whether it's breads cakes tarts pies or pastries bacon is one of the most seductive skills in the kitchen it fills the house with fantastic aromas and puts irresistible food on the table now i'm gonna put you on the road to bacon nirvana starting with an easy bread packed with big gutsy flavors olive tomato and rosemary for catcher absolutely love bacon bread there's something really satisfying about doing it and this focaccia recipe is very hands-on but the end result is something really really tasty first off start with the dough tip 500 grams of strong bread flour into a mixing bowl and add 20 grams of semolina that gives the focaccia its sort of rustic charm now there's one thing for catching needs it's really good seasoning you can't season bread after it's baked so it's got to go in right at the very beginning sprinkling 15 grams of dried yeast take some warm water and then 50 ml of olive oil top of that water that gives it this really nice silky rich texture make a little well mix up that yeast water and oil in start off with your fingers keep your fingers nice and open it's like a little sort of whisk going in there i'm looking for a really nice sort of relaxed dough now that's just starting to come together touch more water with the oil in there give it a little swirl and then again the secret is to sort of knead it gently don't overwork it it's a sort of easy bread to make a nice one to start off with when you're making bread for the first time basically kneading means just knit it together just hanging lightly flour your board and let's just knead that focaccia into a nice smooth dough make sure you don't over add too much flour otherwise it sort of dries out the dough something quite magical about making bread you can switch off and lose yourself my first job for a three mission star establishment was a baker i was 22 years of age i used to start at midnight i was under such a tight schedule one o'clock white bread then two o'clock brown bread three o'clock sourdough four o'clock cheese bread five o'clock proof bake six o'clock crack them open and taste it was amazing beautiful yeah looks stunning it hasn't even risen yet leave your dough to rise in a warm place until it's doubled in size we call this proving [Music] that beautiful a lot of chefs sort of need it for the second time but i'm looking for a really nice light aerated for catcher take a tray a touch of olive oil in there season it at the bottom really important that's the exciting thing about focaccia you've got that really nice sort of salty top and salty bottom and just with a touch of olive oil on your hands gently push that in and almost massage it into the corners it's possible to put sort of olives and tomatoes and garlic through the dough but it never really allows the dough to sort of aerate properly when you put so much ingredients in i'm going to stick mine on top use your finger and sort of just push them in salt on top some pepper on top as well i want some nice fresh amazing rosemary just hold the stalk and just pull off and then just sprinkle down generous in the rosemary really important to have that nice fragrance on top of the fuckacha finish it off before it goes in with a little drizzle of olive oil so it almost sinks in those little pockets of flavor olive tomato rosemary and olive oil into the oven [Music] bake your focaccia at 200 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes smells delicious [Music] beautiful [Music] you can hear how crispy that is you can't beat a nice warm fresh slice of home-cooked focaccia it's rustic charming and it's the perfect way to start baking making homemade for catcher it's so addictive getting to grips with bacon is just a matter of confidence slow cooking is one of the best weapons in the chef's arsenal not only is it easy it's also an incredible way to transform meat into mouthwateringly melting dishes mastering the art of slow cooking is something every cook should learn first up my phenomenal slow cooked beef short ribs slow cooking is a brilliant way of getting lots of extra depth and intensity into your dishes the secret is to lock in all those flavors at the start and let the ingredients do their thing as it cooks these are beef short ribs and there's basically five to six bones across there and as the short rib cooks it sticks that bone the bone implants flavor and the meat just sort of melts cooks slowly gives it that nice level intensity slice alongside the bone straight down you can see that marbling that sort of disappears and disintegrates i'm cooking them in a roasting tray get it on the heat until nice and hot season these short ribs beautifully olive oil in bone on the top we'll start coloring that in [Music] really important to give the beef short rib a really nice sear if you didn't brown the meat off it goes in the oven and it looks like boiled meat so you really want that nice dark rich coloring just cut the garlic in half slide that down the side that's going to give that beef an amazing flavor [Music] to give body to the sauce stir in a heaped teaspoon of tomato puree i'm just hitting the bottom of the pan with that tomato puree and we call it cooking out that smell of puree otherwise it just goes in there raw and it gives this sort of tartness to the braised short ribs red wine in don't use an expensive bottle of red wine there's no need bring the wine up to the boil and reduce it this burns off the alcohol and concentrates the flavor it makes a big difference when you reduce the red wine down by half because it gives that nice dark rich intensity look at my garlic that is just gonna sweeten everything up incredible stock in beef stock perfect chicken stock fine just to about an inch underneath the beef short ribs bring it up to the ball to lock in all that flavor as the beef ribs slow cook cover them so
summary: The transcript details the preparation of several dishes, starting with a stuffed roast chicken using chorizo, cannellini beans, tomatoes, and lemon, seasoned with paprika and roasted to achieve a juicy, flavorful bird. It then moves to a miso-poached salmon with Asian vegetables, where salmon is gently poached in a miso broth infused with kaffir lime, chili, and ginger, served with broccoli, bok choy, and enoki mushrooms. The next dish is a focaccia bread, made with olive oil, rosemary, and tomatoes, kneaded and baked to create a crispy, flavorful loaf. Finally, it describes slow-cooked beef short ribs, seared and braised in a rich red wine and stock sauce, resulting in tender, flavorful meat.

It includes ingredients such as egg, pickles, mayonnaise, sugar, red cabbage, vinegar, cooking alcohol, soy sauce, and wheat flour to create a flavorful and distinctive burger.

summary: In this episode of 'Scrambled,' WWE twins Brie and Nikki Bella join the host to cook a healthy breakfast. The competition begins as they make breakfast sandwiches, with each twin taking turns in a tag-team style to cook. summary: The video demonstrates how to prepare quick and delicious Asian-inspired rice noodle stir-fry, starting by soaking the noodles and cooking thinly sliced chicken with garlic and broccoli in a hot pan. Soy sauce is added for seasoning, and the dish is finished by incorporating scrambled eggs and lime. It also shows how to make light and fluffy gnocchi from leftover baked potatoes, flour, ricotta, and eggs, with thyme and fresh pepper. The gnocchi is boiled, then sauted to develop a crispy texture before being served with peas, butter, and lemon zest. For dessert, a simple yet impressive New York-style cheesecake is made with cream cheese, eggs, lemon zest, and raspberries, baked until golden and souffled.

summary: The transcript discusses the five mother sauces, foundational to French cuisine, created by Auguste Escoffier, and their variations. It begins with Bechamel, a milk-based sauce that is versatile for many dishes, followed by Velout, a stock-based sauce with a velvety texture, which can be enhanced with mustard or herbs. Espagnole, a rich, meat-based sauce with vegetables and stock, is used as the base for various sauces like Bordelaise and Demi-Glace. The process of making these sauces, including the importance of temperature control, seasoning, and cooking techniques, is emphasized to achieve consistency, flavor depth, and smooth textures, essential for elevating dishes in a Michelin-star kitchen.

The host shares his passion for cooking, offering 100 recipes to help anyone improve their cooking skills and enjoy the process.

summary: The chef demonstrates how to make a delicious and affordable steak night dinner, featuring skirt steak, peppercorn sauce, and crispy shoestring fries. He starts by marinating the steak with salt and pepper, allowing it to reach room temperature for even cooking. After searing the steak in a hot pan with garlic and herbs, he prepares the shoestring fries by blanching them twice before frying them until crispy. For the peppercorn sauce, he toasts whole peppercorns, caramelizes shallots and garlic, then adds brandy, beef stock, and cream to create a rich sauce. The dish is served with the steak sliced on the bias, topped with the peppercorn sauce, and paired with the crispy fries seasoned with smoked paprika and Parmesan.

summary: The chef demonstrates several recipes, starting with a stuffed roast chicken featuring chorizo, cannellini beans, tomatoes, and herbs, which keeps the chicken moist and flavorful. The bird is seasoned with lemon, olive oil, and paprika, roasted with white wine and water, and then served with its delicious stuffing and crispy skin. Next, he prepares miso-poached salmon with Asian vegetables, poaching the salmon in a fragrant broth made with miso paste, fish stock, kaffir lime, ginger, and chili, before serving it with broccoli, bok choy, and enoki mushrooms. He also makes focaccia bread, kneading a dough of bread flour, semolina, yeast, and olive oil, topped with tomatoes, rosemary, and salt, then baked until golden. Finally, the chef shows how to make slow-cooked beef short ribs, searing them first for rich flavor, then braising with tomato puree, red wine, garlic, and stock for tender, melt-in-your-mouth results.

summary: This transcript describes the preparation of three different dishes: spicy sausage rice, meatballs in coconut milk, and a quiche. For the rice, sausages are removed from their casings and cooked with onions, peppers, garlic, and spices, before being mixed with rice, wine, and stock to simmer. The meatball recipe involves creating a rich mix with minced beef, breadcrumbs, milk, and seasonings, then cooking the meatballs in a fragrant coconut milk broth, finished with lime zest. The quiche uses shortcrust pastry, filled with pancetta, leeks, cream, and cheese, then baked to a golden, crisp finish. Each dish emphasizes enhancing flavors through careful preparation and cooking techniques.

summary: Eric Wang, chef and founder of Pecking House in Brooklyn, demonstrates how to make his perfect fried rice. He begins by marinating chicken using a velveting technique to improve texture and tenderness, then prepares jasmine rice, which is essential for achieving the right texture in fried rice. After preparing ingredients like eggs, onions, and peas, he stir-fries everything in a wok heated to a high temperature, ensuring quick cooking to maintain flavor and texture. The key steps involve cooking the rice the day before, keeping ingredients prepared, using soy sauce and MSG for seasoning, and finishing with a touch of butter for added richness. The result is a flavorful, smoky, and texturally balanced fried rice.

article: Hi guys, I am Luciano Monosilio The chef and owner of Luciano Cucina Italiana The restaurant in the centre of Rome Our restaurant is very famous for one dish The Carbonara Today I am going to show you how to make my home recipe We have very simple ingredients And then we are going to mix all these ingredients together We will start first from the Guanciale After black pepper Then eggs Parmesan cheese and Pecorino cheese We blend, we mix the cheese It's very important to clean the Guanciale We remove all the black pepper on top and also the skin at the back And then, when the Guanciale is clean We start to cut the Guanciale We make small cubes This has to be the size of Guanciale It is very important because We are going to cook the Guanciale with its fat We don't use olive oil, butter, anything Just Guanciale That's it With the Guanciale already cut We go on the fire If we have gas, we use the iron pan If you don't have gas and use induction, you can use an non-stick pan That is very important for cooking properly the Guanciale The we start with the fire. First we put the fire very high So we warm up the pan When the pan is warm... We put the fire on low We are going in with the Guanciale We can hear it starts frying very low heat When the Guanciale is cooking, we going to make the sauce with the eggs Now we start to make the egg sauce for the Carbonara In my recipe I use only the yolks, the red part of the eggs I use one egg per person If the eggs are small, I use three, one and a half per person Like in this case You see now, the Guanciale starts frying in the pan Grana Padano (Parmesan) And Pecorino When you make the cheese, I suggest to mix Pecorino and Grana Padano (Parmesan) Because the Pecorino sometimes is very salty I suggest to mix to balance the flavor with the Grana Padano So it is less salty That's why we use 2 parts of Pecorino and 1 part of Grana Padano To make Carbonara we use this kind of pan It's called 'Bagno Maria' Later I will show you why we use this type of pan. Cheese Eggs And black pepper See the Guanciale It's crispy outside And should be very soft inside With this fat we make the sauce We put half of this one in the egg sauce And the we remove completely the fat An then we can save the Guanciale And now we mix the sauce We put some pasta water To make our Carbonara we use Spaghetti It's very important that the boiling water is salted but not too much So we put very little salt When the water is boiling We put the Spaghetti And now we have to wait - 12 minutes So guys, we are almost ready We have three minutes left and then we will check the pasta It's very important that the pasta is cooked properly Especially for this recipe we don't do the pasta 'al dente' Because we need the pasta to be cooked properly. It has to be soft because after I show you how to make the Carbonara with the 'Bagno Maria' We check We are ready Some boiling water And now we will wait We cook the pasta in the 'Bagno Maria' because we have the very right temperature like that we cook the eggs very gently we have to have a temperature of 65 degrees centigrade with this technique the eggs with the cheese should be very creamy And then, now we put the Guanciale inside. It's very important the Guanciale has to be hot. Now it is room temperature Some more black pepper And then we prepare the plate We have decided to make this plate for the Carbonara It's a special plate It's not a normal plate, because on the back you have the recipe of the Carbonara The eggs start to be very creamy Now it is ready Now And then we finish the Carbonara with Guanciale on top Some cream And then we finish with the Pecorino cheese on top And black pepper Pecorino cheese And black pepper And that's it: our Carbonara is ready This place is the house of Carbonara Our recipe is very special, because we have decided to make the Carbonara in a different way We try to find a very good balance from the Guanciale and the pasta And also we make very good... flavor of cheese The new generation doesn't like the Pecorino cheese because it is too salty. Actually sometimes it's spicy So we have decided to balance it with the Grana (Parmesan) because first for the flavors to make it more light and after, because Grana is a very creamy cheese the Grana helps us to how to make this cream of our Carbonara You can see it looks like with cream inside but there is no cream inside I hope you are going to enjoy For everything, you just call me up
summary: Luciano Monosilio, chef and owner of Luciano Cucina Italiana in Rome, demonstrates his recipe for Carbonara, which uses simple ingredients: Guanciale, eggs, Parmesan, Pecorino cheese, and black pepper. He begins by cleaning and chopping the Guanciale, then frying it in its own fat over low heat. The egg mixture is made with egg yolks, Pecorino, and Grana Padano cheese, balancing the saltiness of the Pecorino with the creaminess of the Parmesan. The pasta is cooked in salted water and mixed with the egg sauce and Guanciale. The 'Bagno Maria' technique ensures the eggs cook gently, creating a creamy texture without cream. Finally, the dish is finished with more Pecorino, black pepper, and Guanciale on top.

summary: The recipe begins with soaking rice noodles in hot water for 12-15 minutes. Chicken is sliced thinly and flattened using a rolling pin for faster cooking, while garlic and broccoli are prepared. The chicken is cooked in a hot pan with garlic, followed by the broccoli and soy sauce. Afterward, eggs are whisked and added to the pan with the noodles, chicken, and broccoli to form a stir-fry. For gnocchi, leftover baked potatoes are mashed with ricotta, flour, eggs, and thyme, then rolled into small pieces and boiled until they float. After boiling, they are sauted until golden and served with peas and lemon zest. Finally, a simple New York-style cheesecake is made by mixing cream cheese, sugar, eggs, flour, lemon zest, and raspberries, baked until golden and souffled.

summary: After six months of work, the Bad Boys Bakery faces a critical moment as they present their bakery products, including lemon tarts and treacle slices, to Nero's stores. The bakery, which involves prisoners in Brixton prison making the goods, aims to showcase the products and gain approval for continued sales. summary: The transcript covers the preparation of several vibrant and flavorful salads perfect for special occasions. The first dish is a green papaya salad with a robust, spicy, and tangy dressing made from dried shrimp, garlic, chili, tamarind paste, fish sauce, lime, and sugar, topped with fresh herbs and roasted peanuts. Additional salad ideas include a chopped salad with cherry tomatoes, red pepper, salami, chickpeas, and a garlic-sherry dressing; a green bean salad with roasted garlic mustard dressing and toasted almonds; and a roasted red pepper lentil salad with lentils, roasted vegetables, avocado, and fresh herbs. The segment also provides tips for selecting and preparing fresh ingredients like watercress, chicory, and scallops, as well as how to prepare tomatoes and pomegranates for salads. Finally, a dessert recipe for a raspberry mille-feuille is introduced, showcasing puff pastry with vanilla cream and orange zest.
